metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11141 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ReadMATImage function in coders\mat.c in ImageMagick 7.0.5-6 has a memory leak vulnerability that can cause memory exhaustion via a crafted MAT file, related to incorrect ordering of a SetImageExtent call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in github report mdeslaur> This is 0066-CVE-2017-11141-memory-exhaustion-in-ReadMATImage.patch

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
